intro: Leucheria sonchoides, commonly known as the slender milkweed, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, upright stems covered with fine hairs and produces small, yellow-orange flowers arranged in clusters. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Leucheria sonchoides is adapted to grow in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments.
